Course Description:
THIS COURSE IS A FURTHER CONTINUATION OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING I AND WILL STRESS FINANCIAL STATEMENT
ANALYSIS FOR PARTNERSHIPS AND CORPORATIONS. IT WILL ALSO EMPHASIZE CORPORATE ACCOUNTING, CORPORATE
ISSUING AND INVESTING IN DEBT AND EQUITY SECURITIES, FINANCIAL AND CASH-FLOW ANALYSIS, AND DECISION MAKING.
THE COURSE WILL INCLUDE MANUFACTURING ACCOUNTING METHODS USED FOR BUDGETING AND FORECASTING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
AT THE CONCLUSION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO:
COMPUTE AND RECORD DEPRECIATION BY VARIOUS METHODS AND RECORD DISPOSALS OF FIXED ASSETS, AND ACCOUNTING FOR INTANGIBLES.
DEVELOP A WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF PARTNERSHIP ACCOUNTING, INCLUDING FORMATION, DIVISION OF INCOME, AND LIQUIDATION. 
RECORD ENTRIES FOR CORPORATIONS, INCLUDING STOCK AND BOND ISSUANCE, TREASURY STOCK, AND DIVIDENDS.  
ANALYZE AND RECORD INVESTMENTS IN STOCKS AND BONDS.
PERFORM RATIO ANALYSIS ON FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
PREPARE CASH-FLOW STATEMENTS AND ANALYSIS.
PREPARE RETAINED EARNING STATEMENTS.
RESEARCH, PREPARE, AND ANALYZE COMPARATIVE FINANCIAL DATA FOR A CORPORATION. PRESENT FINANCIAL ANALYSIS TO A BUSINESS AUDIENCE.
PREPARE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND RECORD ENTRIES FOR A MANUFACTURING BUSINESS. 
PREPARE A MASTER BUDGET WITH INDIVIDUAL BUDGET COMPONENTS THAT INCLUDE AN OPERATING BUDGET, CAPITAL EXPENDITURES BUDGET, AND A FINANCIAL BUDGET.
Textbook(s): FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING. WAYBRIGHT & KEMP. ISBN: 978-0-13-606048-2. PUBLISHER: PRENTICE HALL. COPYRIGHT: 2010.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
